symptoms.name: Skin lesions
symptoms.pattern: Blisters, nodules, or lesions about 4 mm in diameter, typically at the site of contact with infected livestock; may be systemic in rare cases; lesions may take up to three weeks to appear after contact

physical_findings: Skin lesions (blisters, nodules, or lesions about 4 mm in diameter)
Lesions may be systemic in rare cases
risk_factors: Contact with livestock infected with bovine papular stomatitis

required: Clinical presentation consistent with paravaccinia (skin lesions, fever, fatigue)
